page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This is a rural area very close to the North Cornish coast.There are 3 main centres of population ;Padstow, a small port on the Camel Estuary, to the NE.;St.Merryn,a village,to the west and the hamlet of Little Petherick to the SE.The rest of the population is evenly dispersed, in isolated farms, over the area.In summer the population increases with the influx of tourists. The land rises to the South and the flat topped hills are separated by steep sided valleys generally trending from SE to NW.The valleys are cigar shaped in plan.There are few trees, the wind swept hilltops are barren.Only Little Petherick Creek is wooded and most of the trees are stunted. This is a popular area for retirement and second homes.
